lines.text: And if any of you got anything to say about me or my crew, you say it now, and you say it to my face.
You think I'm gonna let a flake like you marry my little sister?
A flake from Snowflake. How poetic, I like that.
Yeah, that's just my point.
What's your point?
You're a dreamer, and you're not ready for marriage.
Not if I gotta turn into you, Mike.
Forgive us, Father, for what we've done.

[to Mike and David, regarding Travis]
I heard what's been happening in that stupid, little Mormon town of yours. I told you chuckleheads that story was never gonna work, didn't I?

[about Travis]
I searched the woods, but he was... There was nothing. They took him.
Yeah, who is this?
I have a collect call from Travis Walton. Will you accept the charges?
You know, just hang up the phone.
I'll accept it.
Go ahead, sir.
Mike!
Travis?
Help me!

[slightly hoarse]
Space suits.
Yeah, well. I think it's about time we got outta here, what do you boys think?
You're real broken up about your missing buddy, aren't you?
Well, that's very perceptive. That's 'cause he's not my friend.
I got that. Clearly.
Did you? Good. Now, ya' done?
We'll tell you when.
I've been on a case since you disappeared. Where have you been the last five days?
I can't remember.
Dr. Wilson over at the hospital tells me you went without food and water all that time. Was it worth it?
I don't know what you're talking about.
You're saying that you're no longer willing to cooperate?
All we do is cooperate and all we get back from you is grief!
[first lines]

[truck just raced into parking lot]
What the hell is that all about?
[last lines]

[after revisiting the spot of Travis' disappearance]
Let's get going. You gotta go to work. And I'd like go get the hell outta here before they come back.
They won't be back... I don't think they like me.
People in this town are saying terrible things about you.
Well, I don't care what they think.
Well, I do! We live here! Our kids live here! Of course I care! And so should you!

[referring to their daughter]
What's she gonna say, huh? When everybody says her father's a liar or...
Go on, say it.
A liar or a murderer.
Including you? Are you saying that, Kate?
No. No. Of course not. I just, Mike, I just want you to tell me what really happened up there.
I told you what happened. I told you all I know. You believe me, don't you Kate?
You do believe me?
[Kate doesn't answer and then starts to cry]

[runs over to Mike]
Mr. Rogers! Mr. Rogers! You know, I feel like asking you if it's a beautiful day in your neighborhood.
[chuckles]
[Mike just looks at him]
Ray Melendez, Action News Phoenix.
[extends his hand]
How are you?

[doesn't shake his hand]
Look, I just woke up.
Oh, well that's no problem. I just need to ask you a few questions. What do you say, huh?

[gets in his truck]
I got nothing to say.
Well, you see, I figured you would want to kind of like set the record straight. With, uh, things that have been said about you and all. You know...
Well, you figured wrong.
[starts up his truck]
For your own good. For your own good, you know, to just talk to the people, let them know what really happened. What do you say? Come on. Come on.
[Mike drives away]
You got something you wanna say to me?
Go sit down, Buck.
You boys wanna remedy this, we can step outside right now.

[jumps up from his seat]
You got kiddin' me, you fat piece of shit!
Listen, fellas, I want you all to know that there's not a damn thing personal in this. Now where's your friend?
Which one?
Come on, Mike.
The one with the attitude.
If you mean Dallis, I don't know.
We got a proposition for ya'll. I want you to take a lie detector test. If you're telling the truth, it'll sure strengthen your cause.

[looks at the others]
We'll think about it.
I got a good man right here in the state. I mean, you can take it today, tomorrow, anytime that ya'll feel...
I said, we'll think about it!
Why don't we have a little talk, Mike. Outside.
[they both go outside]
Young Greg told us the truth about the cut on Dallis's hand. It wasn't a paper cut, was it? He had an altercation with Travis on the day of the disappearance. Isn't that true?
I guess.

I think you're startin' to get a pretty good feel for who I am, Rogers. I've been at this line of work for a long time. You know what's startin' to bug me? I think maybe you didn't kill your friend. But for the life of me, I can't figure why you're coverin' up.
Let's go.
Where we goin'?
To find Dallis.
Dallis? I thought you don't know where he is.
I lied.
I heard what's been happenin' in that stupid little Mormon town of yours. I told you chuckle heads that story was never gonna work, didn't I.
Well, you know they took away our logging contract, Dallis? Do you know that, huh?
Well that figures. They're all a bunch of chicken shit assholes.
Yeah, well, speakin' of chicken shit, where you been?
I been around. You knew where to find me, didn't you, Mike.
Davis and Watters are lookin' for you, Dallis. They know about your criminal record. They know that you lied about how you hurt your hand. They know that you're full of it...
Yeah, well, you're just full of information today, aren't you, choirboy.
Well, it don't make us look good went you don't...
[starts to argue with him]
No it don't, Dallis! It don't!

[to Mike]
You know, they don't need a body to press murder charges. Did you know that?
[turns to Dave]

Did you know that? Huh? And they ain't never gonna find Travis. And you know that and I know it, right? So then all the pressure's gonna be on Davis and Watters to solve the case. And who do you think they're gonna zero in on, huh?
[to Dave]
What, you, choirboy, huh? God'll send a swarm of locusts down on them.
[to Mike]
And you, uh, Mr. pillar of the community. No, I don't think so. No, the question is, how long before you boys decide to save your lily-white asses and point the finger at me.
That's a load of crud.
No, that's exactly...

[shouts over him]
That's a load!
the way it's gonna be!
